com.riskybusiness.neural

Class Synapse

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.riskybusiness.neural.Synapse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class Synapse
extends Object
implements Serializable

         Describes a connection between two different Neurons. This connection is not weighted; it is up for the Neuron to decide the weights for every input. The Synapse does keep track of the receiving and sending Neurons, and the Synapses method should be called every time a network is to feed a value from one layer to the next.

         Once a sending and receiving Neuron is decided, the index of which the sending Neuron must be determined. This value makes sure that the weight value given to an input on the Neuron is consistent as well as easy to understand. The Synapse will feedForward() method will call the receivers Neuron.addToInput(int, float) method using the index given.

    Since:
    1.6
    See Also:
    Neuron, Serialized Form

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void feedForward()
      Feeds the output from the sending Neuron to the input of the receiving Neuron.
      void feedForward(float... inputs)
      This method should be called when the sending Neuron has no synapses to it, and send the inputs to the sending Neuron to fire.

      Returns the last value sent through this Synapse.

      Returns the neuron index of the receiving Neuron.

    • Method Detail

      • feedForward

        public void feedForward(float... inputs)
                 throws ExceededNeuronInputException,
                        InvalidNeuronInputException

        This method should be called when the sending Neuron has no synapses to it, and send the inputs to the sending Neuron to fire.

        Parameters:
        inputs - The inputs to send to the sending Neuron.
        Throws:
        ExceededNeuronInputException - See the "See also" section.
        InvalidNeuronInputException - See the "See also" section.
        See Also:
        Neuron.addToInput(int, float)

      • feedForward

        public void feedForward()
                 throws ExceededNeuronInputException,
                        InvalidNeuronInputException,
                        NeuronCannotFireException

        Feeds the output from the sending Neuron to the input of the receiving Neuron.

        Throws:
        ExceededNeuronInputException - See the "See also" section.
        InvalidNeuronInputException - See the "See also" section.
        NeuronCannotFireException - When the Neuron cannot fire, as in it doesn't have enough inputs to fire yet.
        See Also:
        Neuron.addToInput(int, float)

        public String toString()
